p: The data in this study were analyzed using a statistical package for social science, version 20. The results of the study were expressed as mean ± standard error of the mean (SEM). Statistical significant differences were determined by one-way ANOVA followed by the post hoc Tukey test to compare urine volume, urine, and serum electrolyte concentration among the controls, standards, HME, and solvent fractions treated groups. P value < 0.05 was considered statistically significant.
